intro: Uragoga lasiorrhachis, commonly known as the redstem filaree, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit and produces small, pinkish to reddish flowers. The plant has slender, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered with fine, soft hairs. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in dry, open areas. Uragoga lasiorrhachis is an annual plant that blooms from spring to early summer.
